name: Courtyard by Marriott Hangzhou Wulin

reviews.text: The Courtyard Hangzhou is like a simplified version of the JW Marriott connected to it. But my stay was just as excellent. My favorite part about the hotel was the breakfast at its MOMO cafe. The cafe is well-designed and the food choices are beyond enough and they are all tasty.
reviews.title: New hotel, good value. Definitely above the average of Courtyards.

reviews.text: The Courtyard Hangzhou Wulin is a real Gem of a hotel. Located next door to the JW Marriott, the Courtyard Hangzhou offers great value, a modern hotel, and an alternative to the more expensive J.W. Marriott next door. The service is excellent. Concierge is very helpful. Staff English skills are very good. The breakfast buffet cost is 147 RMB (Cafe MoMo), a good value considering the expansive nature of the offerings. Eggs made to order. Lots of fruit, breads, pastries, asian food section, cereals, cheeses, etc. The Concierge lounge is nice. Breakfast is not served in the lounge, but if you have lounge access one can enjoy the breakfast buffet downstairs for free. The buffet breakfast at Cafe MoMo is better than a Concierge lounge breakfast ever was. West Lake is not too far away. About $2 in a taxi there, or a twenty minute walk or so. If you have a high floor room you might be able to see West Lake from your hotel room. A high fashion shopping area is one block from the hotel, Hangzhou Tower. There is a lot to see and do in near the hotel. It is a nice, vibrant, central location. I wish all Courtyard hotels were this nice. I would gladly stay at this property again.
reviews.title: Best Courtyard I Ever stayed at

reviews.text: I think I had such a bad experience checking in, it has really put me off thus hotel, even though IRS well above average. Rooms Ok, bed comfortable, gorgeous swimming pool indoor and gym but just something lacking ... Ah yes Atmosphere.
reviews.title: Quite Good but something missing

reviews.text: It is the cheaper sister hotel to the JW Marriott next door and on arrival my taxi dropped me there by mistake and the staff made such a fuss about nothing which was not what I needed after a 13 hour flight.
reviews.title: Great place, new and helpful staffs.....will go back.

reviews.text: I then found my executive class non smoking room reeked of smoke and the wifi would only work standing near the door. It took some time before I could finally get someone to help me. Thanks Meggie. We had to try 5 other rooms before we finally found a room with fresh air on the non smoking floor with wifi that would work.
reviews.title: Nice hotel next to the shopping mall and close to West Lake

reviews.text: Breakfast was to be honest a little disappointing. There is no bar in this hotel but a very nice sports bar below the JWM where the staff know what customer service is all about.
reviews.title: Better than Shangri-la, Away from Westlake.. Very Good

reviews.text: New, spotless luxury hotel with everything beyond expectation, The swimming pool and gym was amazing as it shares all common facilities with the JW marriott. Rooms were excellent and the breakfast buffet was expansive. Family enjoyed the hotel though the town of Hanzhou has less than expected to offer
reviews.title: Amazing hotel for the family

reviews.text: My family (2 adults, 2 kids age 14 and 8) stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in June 2011. Not as nice as the JW Marriott we stayed in Beijing, but definitely the best Courtyard we have ever stayed!
reviews.title: The Best Courtyard Ever Stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facility: The hotel was opened December 2010 and is very new. The gym was open but the pool was not. I used the gym and it was very nice.
reviews.title: smell of cigarette smoke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in: Passports of each person (including children) will be scanned, so the check-in process will take longer than in the US. Please be patient for the check-in process. This is the same for all foreign brand hotels.
reviews.title: New, clean and conventiently located hotel in Hangzhou

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: We got a room with two double beds. The size of the room and the size of the beds are no different from the rooms in the US. The beds are very comfortable. Everything in the room are electronically controlled, including Do Not Disturb (you will not find the paper DND cards) and curtains. The bathroom floors are granite, very upscale and elegant.
reviews.title: Stay Away from the Restaurant

reviews.text: In terms of North American hotel brands in China go, I think Courtyard Marriott is doing a great job. Courtyard is not a 5-star chain, nor it pretends to be. The room is equipped with most every business or leisure travellers need, without the frills and luxury items. For example, most standard bathrooms only come with shower stall. But it's spacious and has the rain shower option. The hotel has only 1 restaurant, and menu is quite limited.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: However this particular Courtyard is benefited from the fact that it is connected to the JW Marriott hotel as well (a bit of a strange business strategy in my opinion). Most local taxi drivers recognize the location of JW Marriott, more so than Courtyard. So I usually just tell them to go there (the entrance of Courtyard is like 10 steps from JW Marriott's). And the JW Marriott bell person would come and welcome me, and give me a card with the taxi's registration number in case I lost anything in that taxi or for whatever reason I need to track that taxi down. This kind of service would not be offered by Courtyard normally. Also, as mentioned before, Courtyard shares the same fitness and spa facilities with JW Marriott, so the Courtyard guests really get an upgraded products in that regard, with a beautifully designed and huge swimming pool, locker rooms with his-or-her own large jacuzzi pool, sauna and steam room.
reviews.title: Will stay again

reviews.text: If I have to be picky, service standards are spotty, and varies from department to department. I had the most amazing experience with the front desk staff. Their staff are not only friendly, but very pro-active in helping me getting what I need or finding how to go. For example, we went to exchange some coins for public buses, and the front desk staff reminded us about the forecast of rain that morning and asked whether we bring our umbrellas with us. When we looked puzzled in our own conversation, their bell staff would approach us and asked whether we need help.
reviews.title: Comforts of home

reviews.text: However, same cannot be said about their restaurant's and housekeeping staff. Some of the restaurant staff can benefit from some basic training on when and how to remove dirty plates, just being more aware of the environment. As to the room cleaning service, I will suggest their floor supervisors to do checks on "cleaned rooms" to see what more needs to be done. And one day when I got back to our room, the window was left open. We called someone to come in and close it as we couldn't do it. Their housekeeping staff also did not know how to close it and had to call a staff from Engineering to "fix" it. He came quickly and closed the window just by pushing it fully outward first (which is the trick I suppose). I think this info should be passed on to all Housekeeping staff (the cleaning staff who opened it while cleaning the room should have closed the window when finished, instead of leaving it open for us to deal with).
reviews.title: Great stay here

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great, 10 minute walk to the Wulin mall with many restaurant options (Grandma's Restaurant is one of my favourites) . It's also only 10-minute walk the airport shuttle service (it's only 20 RMB one way, with a 15-minute frequency during 9am to 5pm, or 30-minute outside of that period). To get to Westlake, you need to take a taxi (Hangzhou is bigger than it looks on map). 10 RMB is sufficient, or you can take a local bus which costs about 1 to 2 RMB.
reviews.title: Loved it!

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Hangzhou Wulin Hotel
description: Known for its scenic beauty, Hangzhou, China treasures its pagodas, lakes, and cultural heritage. Courtyard Hangzhou Wulin offers an ideal location in our magnificent city, right in the heart of Hangzhou's down business and shopping areas. Close by, you will find the breathtaking West Lake, celebrated skyline, convenient railway station and international airport. Our modern accommodations offer deluxe and executive rooms, as well as spacious suites. The executive lounge features spectacular views of downtown. In each room, you will find luxurious bedding, individual climate control, high-speed Internet, mini-bar, and bottled water. In the morning and after a busy day, enjoy a great meal at MoMo Café. Work out anytime at our 24-hour fitness centre. And, enjoy a swim in the indoor pool and relax in the sauna and whirlpool. Whether visiting Hangzhou for business or leisure, you'll find friendly staff, first-class amenities and superb location at the Courtyard Hangzhou Wulin.
